issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
AssignMultiple is generally set to false to prevent overloading a Node (for eg, new NMs that have just joined)

A possible scheduling optimization would be to disregard this directive for apps whose allowed locality is NODE_LOCAL
fields.summary: Disregard 'assignMultiple' directive while scheduling apps with NODE_LOCAL resource requests

comments.body: Attaching initial patch to validate approach.. will include test-case shortly

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks for working on this, [~asuresh]. Comments:
# What do you think of a new class to maintain details about node-local-only requests to avoid complicating the already-complex FairScheduler class? This would essentially host the concurrent-hash-map here, and methods to {{addIfNodeLocalOnlyRequest}}, {{removeIfNodeLocalOnlyRequest}} and {{isNodeLocalOnlyRequest}}.
# Also, would be nice to comment on what the map is actually mapping, since the key for outer-map is a String.
# While examining each request to see if it is node local only, 
## it appears we include rack-local-only requests as well. Can we add a test to ensure this doesn't happen? 
## we seem to be creating a ConcurrentHashMap for the app always. We should create this only if one hasn't already been created.
Canceling patch to address review comments.

Thanks [~asuresh] for working on this. I see the patch continues assigning on the node if you have *any* app which has a specific request on that node. But the scheduling attempt (via queueMgr.getRootQueue().assignContainer(node)) does not restrict which apps will get allocation on that node. So one could end up assigning the next container on the node for an app which may not have a specific request for that node. 
I see two choices. 
a) Smaller change - We should allow subsequent assignments only for the node local only apps? And you already have that list in the map. That can end up prioritizing the application's node local request over other applications.
b) BIgger change - Once we have picked the app based on priority, we allow it to assign multiple containers if there are multiple node local requests for that node.
